An epitome of the vvorlds woe vvherein is perspicuously discouered, the lamentable miseries of the world, in these tempestuous times, the infidelitie of fained friends, and ficklenesse of deceitefull fortune : continued by way of meditation and resolution / by Geo. Dichante, gent. Dichante, George.
[58] p.
Printed by Thomas Cotes, and Richard Cotes, London : 16[30]
In verse. Running title: The woe of the world. Imprint date (cropped) suggested by STC (2nd ed.). Imperfect: cropped, with some loss of print. Reproduction of original in the Henry E. Huntington Library and Art Gallery.
=======
